title: Dedicate separate macOS CI machines for gazebo and sdformat/ignition?

content.raw:
We currently have 3 macOS CI machines so that we can build bottles for the 3 OS distros supported by Homebrew, but we only use one machine for our regular CI testing in order to have consistent results. Since the gazebo builds can take a long time, it could be convenient to use one machine for building gazebo and a separate machine for sdformat and ignition CI. I believe this could be configured with the following patch:

~~~
diff -r aea27fa1cd4f jenkins-scripts/dsl/gazebo.dsl
--- a/jenkins-scripts/dsl/gazebo.dsl	Tue Jan 23 12:57:44 2018 +0100
+++ b/jenkins-scripts/dsl/gazebo.dsl	Tue Jan 23 18:01:44 2018 -0800
@@ -518,6 +518,8 @@
                               "https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo")
 gazebo_brew_ci_any_job.with
 {
+    label "osx_gazebo"
+
     steps {
       shell("""\
             #!/bin/bash -xe
@@ -557,6 +559,8 @@
 
   gazebo_brew_ci_job.with
   {
+      label "osx_gazebo"
+
       triggers {
         scm('@daily')
       }
~~~

Does anyone object to this proposal?
